p.text: [p]Late one night you and your friends visit the old fairgrounds. They're putting up rides and booths for the annual carnival. But this year things ook really different. Really odd. Really scary.[/p] [p]The place is lit up by a hundred fiery torches. And spooky music is coming from the main tent. Then you meet Big Al, the creepy carnival manager. He's invited you in to test some of the rides.[/p] [p]Will you brave the terrifying Supersonic Space Coaster? Risk the horrors of the Reptile Petting Zoo? Slice through the oily waters of Booger Bog? Or confront the evil Snake Lady?[/p]

[p]Welcome to the Carnival of Horrors. This is no ordinary carnival. Here you'll find awesome rides. Exciting games of chance. And the weirdest Freak Show ever.[/p] [p]Do you dare to enter?[/p] [p]Are you brave enough to risk the Supersonic Space Coaster? Can you make it through the House of Horrors alive?[/p] [p]This scary adventure is all about [em]you.[/em] You decide what will happen. And you decide how terrifying the scares will be.[/p]

[p]“What do [em]you[/em] want to do?”[/p] [p]“I don't know, Patty. What do [em]you[/em] want to do?”[/p] [p]“Not fair, Brad. I asked you first.”[/p] [p]Patty and Brad. Your two best friends. Arguing. As usual.[/p] [p]It's the last week of August. And Patty and Brad haven't stopped fighting since your summer vacation started.[/p] [p]Patty likes being bossy. You don't mind, though. It's no big deal.[/p] [p]It's hard to win a fight with her anyway. You don't know why Brad even tries. You guess it's because he doesn't want to look like a wimp in front of a girl.[/p] [p]“There's nothing to do. I guess I'll just go home,” Brad says. He shoves his hands in his pockets. Then his shoulders slump and he sort of shrivels up. You guess Brad is kind of a wimp – even if he is your best friend.[/p] [p]“You're so boring, Brad,” Patty complains. Whenever Patty complains, her freckles really pop out. Now there are about a million of them spread across her face.[/p] [p]“Hey! I know what we should do!” Patty suddenly bursts out.[/p]

[p]“Let's bike over to Bennet's Field and watch them set up the carnival!"[/p] [p]“I don't know," you answer. “It's getting dark and Mom said I have to be in by nine."[/p] [p]“It's only a quick bike ride," Brad says. “Are you some kind of wimp?"[/p] [p]Brad calling you a wimp? You can't believe it![/p] [p]“Okay. Okay," you agree. “But if it's as bad as last year, there won't be much to see. Don't you remember the main attraction?” you remind them. “The ride they called Terror Track? It turned out to be a baby choo-choo train that circled around and around and around."[/p] [p]It doesn't matter what you say. Patty's made up her mind. You're going to ride over to the carnival.[/p] [p]A hot, humid breeze blows in your face as you pedal along. Patty's in the lead. No surprise. And Brad's puffing behind you.[/p] [p]It's dark by the time you reach Bennet's Field.[/p] [p]You and your friends drop your bikes in the grass and race across the moonlit field, toward the huge wooden fence that surrounds the carnival.[/p]
p.next: Take a closer look

p.text: [p]As you reach the carnival entrance, you hear music coming from inside. Not the usual corny organ stuff they always play. But some really strange music. It sounds familiar and totally new at the same time.[/p] [p]Brad stretches his neck to try to peer over the fence. But no luck. The fence is way too high.[/p] [p]Patty jiggles the padlock on the door. It's sealed shut.[/p] [p]“I guess we'll have to wait until tomorrow night when the carnival opens,” Brad says.[/p] [p]“No way,” Patty says. “Let's climb the fence. Now!”[/p] [p]“Are you crazy?” Brad says. “We'll get caught!”[/p] [p]“Come on. There's probably no one in there,” Patty replies.[/p] [p]Your friends turn to you to cast the deciding vote. You glance at your watch. It's almost 9:00 P.M. If you're going to get home in time, you should start back now.[/p] [p]What are you going to do?[/p]
p.next: If you decide to go home
If you climb the fence to get inside

p.text: [p]“Wh-what do you mean?” Brad asks, trembling all over.[/p] [p]“I just had an idea. A great idea,” the man replies. "I want you kids to stay and try out the rides before the grand opening tomorrow.”[/p] [p]Patty's eyes open wide. “Cool!” she says.[/p] [p]“Are you sure it's all right with the owner?” you ask.[/p] [p]“I'm Big Al, the manager. And what I say around here goes.”[/p] [p]Big Al digs around in his checkered jacket and pulls out three maps. He hands one to each of you.[/p] [p]“Study them carefully,” he says. “If you have any questions, ask them now.”[/p] [p]Your eyes fall upon the map. You have a question. But when you gaze up, Big Al is gone. He's vanished![/p] [p]“A whole carnival to ourselves!” Patty exclaims. “Where should we start?”[/p] [p]You stare down at your map once again. You notice that the carnival is split in half. On one side are the rides. Tons of them. On the other side is the midway, packed with games of chance and the Freak Show.[/p] [p]What will you try first?[/p]
p.next: To go on the rides
To check out the midway

p.text: [p]“Come on, run!” you yell to Patty and Brad as you spin around. “There's got to be another way out!”[/p] [p]Big Al blow's a whistle. Its shrill blast hurts your ears. He blow's it again and, suddenly, dozens and dozens of carnival people appear out of nowhere. But they don't look the way they did before.[/p] [p]Some have green flesh. Some are deathly white. Their rotting skin hangs from their bones. Above their sunken cheekbones, their eyes glow an eerie yellow.[/p] [p]You w'atch in horror as more and more of them appear.[/p] [p]What should you do? Your legs won't budge. You can't think clearly. You're terrified! You stand there – frozen – in a trance.[/p] [p]But Brad breaks the spell when he screams out, “They're ghosts! That's why they're wearing those old-fashioned clothes. They're dead!”[/p] [p]“Watch out! Over there!” Patty yells. “That – that ghost … it's coming right at us. Run!”[/p]

[p]“Let's do it!” you say to your friends. “Let's climb the fence!”[/p] [p]Patty is halfway up before you finish speaking. You let Brad go next. You're last.[/p] [p]It's a hard climb up. There's really no place on the fence to get a good grip. But you make it to the top, swing your legs over, and tumble down. You land on the grass. You're inside![/p] [p]You and your friends gaze around. It's pretty dark – the only light comes from torches. At first the carnival looks the same as it always does. Dinky rides. Hot dog wagons. Then the lights stall to flicker on in every corner of the field – the rides start to move. It's as if the whole place is magically coming to life.[/p] [p]“Hey! Look at that giant roller coaster!” you exclaim, pointing up ahead. “They never had a roller coaster before!”[/p] [p]“Yeah,” Brad agrees. “And the whole place is a lot bigger than last year!”[/p] [p]“This is awesome!” Patty says as she sprints toward the rides.[/p]

[p]You and Brad take off after Patty. You all stop in front of the roller coaster.[/p] [p]“Wow!” Patty says as she gazes up at it. “It's like a rocket to outer space!”[/p] [p]Beyond the roller coaster, you spy a castle surrounded by a moat. And a spooky-looking haunted house sitting high atop a hill.[/p] [p]“These are the coolest rides I've ever seen!” you say. “They still have that dumb choo-choo train over there,” you point out, “but we could ride this stuff all night and never go near it!”[/p] [p]Patty grabs your arm and tugs you over to the other side of the carnival – to the midway. Brad races after you.[/p] [p]“Hey! Where are all those dinky wooden booths from last year?” you ask as you gawk at the amazing games of chance.[/p] [p]They're gone. And in their place are giant video games and huge spinning wheels studded with hundreds of blinking colored lights![/p] [p]“Get a load of that!” Brad suddenly cries out.[/p] [p]You and Patty spin around.[/p] [p]You can't believe what you see![/p]
p.next: Be more amazed

p.text: [p]You wander over to the Wheel of Chance and immediately notice two strange things.[/p] [p]First, you read the sign on the booth. It says Wheel of No Chance. Then you hear the barker's voice calling, “Step right up!” But there's no one there.[/p] [p]No one but a green-and-yellow parrot.[/p] [p]“Excuse me,” you say, hoping someone will answer. “Is this game open?”[/p] [p]“No, I'm standing by this wheel for my health,” the parrot cracks. “Now do you want to spin or what?”[/p] [p]The parrot is obviously annoyed. “Mammals,” he mutters. “Can't live with them, can't live without them.”[/p] [p]You steal a glance around. Maybe you should skip this game. But Big Al sneaks up behind you.[/p] [p]“Spin,” he says. “You must earn enough points to win.”[/p] [p]“But how will I know if I have enough points?” you ask.[/p] [p]“[em]Spin![/em]” It's his final word.[/p] [p class="inlineImage"][img src="resources/gyg1/8.jpg" /][/p]

[p]You've decided not to sneak into the carnival? You're going home instead? Well, it's a good thing Patty usually makes all the decisions. Otherwise, you'd never have any fun! And this book would be over before it began![/p] [p]Go ahead. Take a deep breath. Then go climb the fence. You're not [em]scared[/em] – are you?[/p]

[p]You've decided to help the freaks. As you race down the midway, you spot Brad and Patty.[/p] [p]“Listen, guys,” you tell them, lowering your voice. “We've got a problem. A big problem.”[/p] [p]You take a deep breath and tell them all about Madame Zeno and the blue card.[/p] [p]“So,” you finish saying, “somebody might need our help in the back of the Freak Show.”[/p] [p]“What's a freak?” Brad asks nervously.[/p] [p]“Remember the poster we saw when we came in? The one with the three-headed man and the lady with the snake body?” you remind him.[/p] [p]Brad bites down on his lip. “Are they really real?”[/p] [p]“Sure they're real,” Patty chimes in. “I once sawr a bearded lady at the circus.”[/p] [p]“I don't know,” Brad says. “It sounds kind of creepy.”[/p] [p]“Well, Madame Zeno said this wras my fate. I'm going to help them – whatever they are. Are you guys in?”[/p] [p]“You bet,” Patty answers, her eyes shining with excitement.[/p] [p]“Okay, okay. I'll go,” Brad mumbles.[/p] [p]“Then let's hurry!” you exclaim.[/p]
p.next: Race to the back of the Freak Show

p.text: [p]You run to the right. "‘Follow me!” you cry out to Patty and Brad.[/p] [p]You run faster than you've ever run in your life. Your sides ache, but you keep on going.[/p] [p]When your chest feels as if it's about to burst, you finally stop. And hear a crash behind you. Then at both sides of you. Then in front of you. Trapping you.[/p] [p]“Welcome to the Reptile's Petting Zoo,” a deep voice echoes through the darkness.[/p] [p][em]Reptile's[/em] Petting Zoo? You thought the sign said [em]Reptile[/em] Petting Zoo.[/p] [p]“Our alligator has been so lonely,” the deep voice continues. “Waiting and waiting – for his new pets to arrive. And here you are – finally.”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]The room is dark, but all around you, you hear hushed moans. “Help us! Help us!”[/p] [p]“We're in a prison,” Patty says. “And look at the prisoners! They're weird!”[/p] [p]Patty is right. As your eyes grow accustomed to the darkness, you see cell after cell. Each one holds a strange-looking prisoner. There's an enormous fat lady who's nearly busting out of the bars. A giant. A dwarf. A young lady with boa constrictors wrapped around her waist. And a woman with a long black beard![/p] [p]“We're the freakssss,” the Snake Lady says. “Every night when the show ends, the master locks us up.”[/p] [p]“The master? You mean Big Al is – ” you start to say.[/p] [p]“You must help us!” the giant interrupts.[/p] [p]“Sssssssh,” the Snake Lady says. “The mas-ter'sssss coming – you mustn't be here! Go! That way!” She points to a door down the hall.[/p]
p.next: Escape through the door down the hall
Stay and talk to Big Al

p.text: [p]You reach out slowly and touch the red card.[/p] [p]To your amazement a 3-D heart magically appeal's and rises from the flat surface. Then it starts to beat! [em]Tha-dump, tha-dump.[/em] It must be some fancy optical illusion. You lean closer to figure out the trick.[/p] [p]“Yowwwww!” you screech and jerk back to avoid the warm red liquid that nearly squirts in your eye. Is it blood? It looks like blood. “Wow! Cool effect,” you say. “How did you do it?”[/p] [p]“Turn over the card,” Madame Zeno orders. “Do it now!”[/p] [p]Madame Zeno really gets into her act. Doesn't she know this is just a game? you think. But you do as you're told.[/p] [p]Big deal. No weird pictures. No hidden fortunes. All you see are the numbers [em]1, 3, 2[/em] shimmering in gold script against a midnight background. “What does it mean?” you ask.[/p] [p]“You will know when the time is right,” the fortune-teller whispers. Her voice is so low, you can barely hear her. “It could save your life!”[/p]
p.next: What does she mean?

p.text: [p]Round and round the wheel spins. It finally lands on number [em]15.[/em] [span class="attribute"]NO CHANCE[/span].[/p] [p]No chance. Does that mean wThat you think it means?[/p] [p]No chance at all.[/p] [p]Zip.[/p] [p]Zero.[/p] [p]Nothing.[/p] [p]Nada.[/p] [p]Negatory.[/p] [p]Yes. That's exactly what it means. You have met…[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Hi!” you say to Big Al. “Who are all those people?”[/p] [p]He doesn't really answer your question.[/p] [p]“Welcome to the Carnival of Horrors,” he says. “You [em]must[/em] play or pay. We have many games on our midway. You [em]must[/em] play two.” He practically spits the word [em]must[/em] out. “If you succeed, you can win prizes. But if you lose, you pay with your life!”[/p] [p]Boy, he's really laying it on thick, you think. But it's a pretty cool gimmick. “Okay, I'll play a game. Then I've got to go home.”[/p] [p]“No one goes home,” Big Al says, “until they play. You must play [em]two[/em] games. And survive.”[/p] [p]“Okay. Okay,” you mutter to yourself.[/p] [p]You glance around the midway at the two closest games. Guess Your Weight on Mars and the Wheel of Chance. You have to pick one to start, or you'll never get out of here.[/p]
p.next: For Guess Your Weight on Mars
To play Wheel of Chance

p.text: [p]You take a few steps along the midway hoping you've won enough prizes and points. You notice the crowd of people surrounding Big Al. They're still chanting, “PAY OR PLAY. PAY OR PLAY.”[/p] [p]You break through the crowd and grab Big Al's arm. “Hey! Do you know where my friends are?” “Certainly,” Big Al says, pointing up ahead. “They're right over there!”[/p] [p]“Patty! Brad!” you shout as you rush up to them. “Come on! We've got to go! This carnival is evil!”[/p] [p]But before they can say a word, Big Al's voice booms from behind you. “Not before The Final Challenge!”[/p]

[p]The space lady slowly circles you as she sizes you up from head to toe. “Hmmmm, I think you weigh thirty-eight pounds.”[/p] [p]“[em]Thirty-eight pounds![/em] Boy, are you wrong!” “I'm never wrong,” she says, smirking. She snaps her fingers and two enormous guards appear. They each take one of your arms and drag you out of the courtyard.[/p] [p]“I don't weigh thirty-eight pounds!” you yell. But then you remember. It isn't your weight on Earth that matters. It's your weight on Mars.[/p] [p]Do you weigh thirty-eight pounds on Mars? You'd better find out quickly, because something tells you that what Big Al said about having to survive [em]might[/em] be true.[/p]

[p]You land on number [em]19[/em].[/p] [p]``Double or nothing. Double or nothing'' two voices behind you echo.[/p] [p]You whirl around – and gasp! It's a man with two heads.[/p] [p]“Congratulations. You win ten points,” one head says to you. “Quit while you're ahead!”[/p] [p]“[em]Ahead[/em], get it? A head!” the other head adds, laughing hysterically.[/p] [p]“Shut up,” head number one says.[/p] [p]“You shut up,” head number two shoots back. “Ten points is nothing. You better spin again. And this time it's double or nothing. You get double the points wherever you land.”[/p] [p]Which head should you listen to?[/p]
p.next: If you think you don't have enough points

have.next: If you think you have enough points

dontHave.next: If you think you have enough points

p.text: [p]It seems as if hours have passed. Or maybe it's only minutes.[/p] [p]You try to unclasp your hands. But they won't budge. It's as if your arms are glued around your knees.[/p] [p]You try to move something. Anything.[/p] [p]But you can't blink an eyelid. Your body is paralyzed. You can't even scream.[/p] [p]A door opens and two men dressed in overalls and wearing gas masks amble in. Finally. They're here to rescue you![/p] [p]“Looks like the perfume worked,” you hear one of them say.[/p] [p]“Yeah. And just in time. We needed a new dummy for the Real-Life Space Display,” the other adds.[/p] [p]They pick up your rigid body and carry you out. No wonder those astronauts in the silver tunnel looked so real![/p] [p]Sorry. You can't scream. You can't escape.[/p] [p]Next time, you promise yourself, you'll stick with the baby rides. But then you remember – there isn't going to be a next time … because this is …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You're outside – standing in Bennet's Field – gazing at the fence that surrounds the carnival.[/p] [p]“I guess we'll have to wait until tomorrow night when the carnival opens,” Brad says.[/p] [p]“No way,” Patty says. “Let's climb the fence.”[/p] [p]What's going on here?[/p] [p]You guessed it. The silver locker was a time machine. You've gone back in time to the first moment you spotted the carnival. Now it appears as if you have to start all over again – fighting horror after horror, right up to …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You're pretty sure that the space lady guessed wrong! Now all you have to do is step on the scale to prove it.[/p] [p]The two goons shove you inside the planet simulation chamber. It's a long narrow tube, and it's really stuffy inside. You can barely breathe.[/p] [p]You step up on the scale. You check the readout. Boy, oh, boy! The space lady [em]is[/em] wrong![/p] [p]You jump up and down. “I won! I won!”[/p] [p]Back outside you collect your prize. It's a huge chocolate bar. You take a big bite out of it and stuff the rest in your pocket.[/p] [p]You gaze around. The coast is clear. Maybe you can find Patty and Brad and get out of here.[/p] [p]You walk a few steps forward. But a heavy hand clamps down on your shoulder from behind.[/p] [p]It's Big Al.[/p] [p]“It's time to play another game,” he says, grinning.[/p]

[p]You yank on the reins. But your horse plows ahead, pulling you forward – closer and closer to the chopping, chopping, chopping blades. Brad squinches down in the cart and buries his head in his lap.[/p] [p]Patty jumps into the front seat with you. Together you pull on the reins and scream, "Whoa, fellow! Whoa!”[/p] [p]But your horse trots onward. "It's no use,” you cry. "We'd better jump!”[/p] [p]You stare over the side. You're riding along a narrow ridge and there's a deep drop that makes your blood run cold! If you jump, you'll plunge to your death![/p] [p]Then you glance up ahead – and spot a safer place to leap. Great![/p] [p]You are about to show it to your friends when Brad cries out, "Look at the elves! They chop at set times. If we can get the horse to move faster, we can miss the axes!”[/p] [p]"That's dumb, we should jump!” argues Patty.[/p] [p]What do you think you should do?[/p]
p.next: If you decide to jump out
If you urge the horse to gallop

p.text: [p]Carnival workers. The carnival workers who set up the same rinky-dink carnival you go to every summer.[/p] [p]You can't believe your eyes. You must be seeing things![/p] [p]Patty tries to say something smart, but the only thing she manages is “Huh?”[/p] [p]“Hey, kids!” a worker yells at you. “Get away from that ride. The carnival doesn't start till tomorrow night.”[/p] [p]You gaze around in wonder at the faded games, the baby rides, the tacky food stands. For the first time in your life, it all looks great![/p] [p]“We'll be there!” you shout as you head for your bikes. “This is the greatest carnival I've ever seen!”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Seconds later your head and the back of your feet slam into the wall. You're hanging upside down – in the middle of a gigantic magnetic wheel![/p] [p]“Are you ready for The Final Challenge?” Big Al asks.[/p] [p]“Of course not!” you say. “LET ME DOWN!”[/p] [p]“We'll let you down – but not until you face The Final Challenge. One spin will decide your fate. If you win, you go. If you lose, you stay here forever.”[/p] [p]Will that be your fate?[/p] [p]Big Al approaches the wheel.[/p] [p]Brad and Patty are holding on to each other.[/p] [p]Your heart is pounding.[/p] [p]Your hands are sweating.[/p] [p]This is it. One spin.[/p] [p]He gives the wheel – with you on it – a hard turn. Where will it stop? Guess![/p]
p.next: On 44?
On 74?

p.text: [p]“Hey, wait up!” you yell to Brad and Patty as you sprint through the Space Coaster gate.[/p] [p]They both ignore you and charge straight ahead. You follow them into a narrow tunnel that leads to the boarding area.[/p] [p]You gaze down at the floor. Black rubber. It makes you walk with a strange bounce.[/p] [p]Every few feet there is a round porthole window. When you glance out one, you see astronauts planting flags on the moon. You peer out another. Now they're seated in their capsule. This is amazing, you think. The figures look real. Totally real.[/p] [p]After a long climb, you and Patty and Brad finally arrive at the loading area.[/p] [p]A sleek bullet-shaped capsule [em]whooshes[/em] up and stops right beside you. It has three sections. Brad climbs defiantly into the last section. You leap into the front. Patty's left with the middle section.[/p] [p]And suddenly you're trapped![/p]

[p]The crowd is closing in. Your pockets are empty – you have nothing to defend yourself with. So you run![/p] [p]You spot a crack in the wall, next to the wheel. It's small – too small for an adult to squeeze through – but you can probably make it.[/p] [p]“Follow me!” you yell out to Patty and Brad as you squeeze through the opening. It leads to a backstage area – and then to the flap of another tent.[/p] [p]You can hear the crowd behind you, trying to follow you through the crack.[/p] [p]“Come on! We can slip under this tent,” you say. For once, no one argues with you.[/p] [p]The three of you duck in and find yourself surrounded by another crowd. They are all seated in chairs. And they don't move. They just stare at you with glassy eyes.[/p]

[p]What's the big idea? You're going to embarrass the giant into helping you.[/p] [p]“Hey, you. You know, you're a real wimp,” you say to the giant.[/p] [p]He looks at you as if he can't believe what he hears.[/p] [p]Patty and Brad look at you as if you're crazy.[/p] [p]Maybe you are.[/p] [p]“You wimp,” you continue. “You sit here all day, taking orders from that creep, Big Al. And you live in these horrible conditions. Why? Because you're a wimp and you refuse to fight back. You could bend those bars and escape – but you won't. Because you are a wimp – W-I-M-P – wimp.”[/p] [p]The giant stands. You gaze up. He's over fifteen feet tall. He lumbers over to you. He isn't smiling.[/p] [p]Is your plan going to work? Is he going to bend the bars to prove you wrrong? Or is he going to bend you?[/p] [p]It's out of your control now.[/p] [p]Look out the window.[/p]
p.next: If if's sunny out
If it's raining or if it's nighttime

p.text: [p]You stumble down the corridor to your right. As you peer from side to side, you are met with hundreds of images of – you! And you look pretty baffled. And scared.[/p] [p]“Hey, I could use some help,” you call out.[/p] [p]Silence.[/p] [p]You pound your fist against the wall.[/p] [p]The wall starts to move.[/p] [p]Just an inch or two – an inch or two closer to you![/p] [p]You take a step back – but the wall behind you is moving, too.[/p] [p]The walls are moving together. They're closing in on you.[/p] [p]You're going to be crushed![/p]

[p]You're falling … falling ... You can't think of anything else to do, so you stall flapping your arms like a bird.[/p] [p]At that moment a huge gust of air shoots up from under you and blows you back onto the bridge.[/p] [p]Breathing hard, you run the rest of the way across the rickety span. When you reach the safety of the other side, you glance back. And gasp! The bridge and the midway beyond it have vanished! Only a black void remains![/p] [p]“Wow! Awesome special effects!” you cry out loud. But was your fall part of the special effects, too? It didn't feel like it.[/p] [p]You spin around to face the House of Horrors. Up close it appears really, really creepy. Cobwebs drip down from its roof and an eerie yellow light glows inside. Cool! Next to the house you spot a sign that reads [span class="attribute"]boat trip to nowhere[/span]. There are amazing speedboats that you can drive yourself.[/p] [p]Which should you try first?[/p]
p.next: Want to try the Boat Trip to Nowhere?
Ready for the House of Horrors?

p.text: [p]You snap your head around to the right – where you hear footsteps coming toward you.[/p] [p]You are facing a short man with wrinkly skin and bloodshot eyes. His bushy, black hair resembles a scouring pad – and from the looks of it, it probably feels like one, too. His evil expression makes you cringe.[/p] [p]But he's nothing compared to the “things” in back of him – two seven-foot-tall monsters. One has blue horns and bulging red eyes. The other has scaly skin and an alligator snout that snaps open and closed as he eyes you.[/p] [p]The trio all wear lab coats. And from the eager way they're looking at you, you realize that you are the lab rat.[/p] [p]You struggle to escape from the net. But you're trapped in the webbing. Like a fly in a spider's web.[/p] [p]“Welcome to my humble laboratory,” the short man says. “I am Dr. Frank N. Stone, the mastermind who created the Carnival of Horrors.”[/p] [p]The Carnival of Horrors! You don't like the sound of that![/p]

[p]Your boat glides through the channel at high speed to Booger Bog. Water sprays up into your face. But soon you have to slow down. Trees have suddenly sprung up all around you. You're completely surrounded now by their towering trunks.[/p] [p]In the dark light, their limbs take on the shape of gnarled arms with blackened, bony fingers at the ends. You stare hard at the tree trunks. Could it be? Are they reaching out for you?[/p] [p]You slowly weave the boat through the twisted trunks and branches. They've grown so thick here that you can barely pilot your boat through them.[/p] [p]The trees rustle as if they're whispering to each other. Their limbs begin to sway. As you glide carefully through the water, the leaves slap against your face. [em]Slap. Slap. Slap.[/em][/p] [p]Your heart starts hammering away in your chest. This is really scary. Just how far is nowhere? you begin to wonder. Something swipes at your hair! What [em]was[/em] that?[/p]

[p]You glance once more at the dwarf. He lets out an evil cackle. That's it – there's no way you can trust him. Besides, you can hear music up ahead. You're sure you must be near an exit.[/p] [p]“No, thanks. I don't need any help,” you mumble.[/p] [p]He shrugs. “Oh, yes, you do,” he says. But then he sprints off.[/p] [p]You walk in the direction of the music. But after five minutes, you realize that you're not getting anywhere.[/p] [p]Maybe you should have followed the dwarf. You start to think about Patty and Brad. Are they okay? you wonder.[/p] [p]Just when you think you'll be wandering these tunnels for the rest of your life, the passageway ends! Now you're facing two doors – one red and one blue. Which one should you try? You might as well flip a coin![/p] [p][img src="../resources/flick.jpg" /][/p]

[p]“Let's go on the rides first!” you say. “That roller coaster looked awesome!”[/p] [p]“Okay,” Patty agrees. “Over this way!” she yells as she charges over to it.[/p] [p]When you reach the rides, you can only stare in amazement. These are the most fantastic rides you've ever seen. The towering roller coaster … the soaring speedboats … the twisty slides! Every one is in motion. Whizzing, whirling, doing loop-the-loops. And they're all empty! No ridel's. No people in line![/p] [p]“Cool!” Patty exclaims. “We have the wrhole place to ourselves.”[/p] [p]Brad's face turns a little green as his gaze swings from the Supersonic Space Coaster to the Doom Slide. “Do you think they have rides that don't go upside down?” he asks.[/p] [p]“Come on! Let's check out the coaster!” Patty calls to you and Brad. Then they run off to its starting gate.[/p] [p]You stop and crane your neck to gaze up at the coaster's first hill. And you gasp![/p]

[p]Five minutes later, the three of you are sneaking down a dark alley. Brad is so frightened, he's practically walking on top of you.[/p] [p]The alley is littered with large cardboard boxes and overflowing trash cans. And it smells like dead fish.[/p] [p]“Hey! Quit stepping on my shoe," you say to Brad.[/p] [p]“I'm not stepping on your shoe,” he shoots back. “I'm not anywhere near your stupid shoe.”[/p] [p]You glance down. And nearly scream.[/p] [p]Brad's right. He's not stepping on you. But about a dozen rats are.[/p] [p]You shake your foot wildly. The rats scurry off.[/p] [p]Brad catches sight of the rats and tries to bolt.[/p] [p]You and Patty quickly pull him back.[/p] [p]“Hey! Look!” Patty says, pointing up ahead. “A door!”[/p] [p]On the door you see a big sign that reads [span class="attribute"]keep OUT[/span], so … you go in.[/p]

[p]You turn back and head in the other direction. Your reflections bounce off the walls at crazy angles. Are you walking straight, or have you rounded a corner? There's no way to tell. Yet this time you're sure you're going the right way![/p] [p]“Over here!” a voice calls. “Turn left again!”[/p] [p][em]Turn left again?[/em] Now you are really confused.[/p] [p]If you turn left again, will you finally escape?[/p]
p.next: HELP!

p.text: [p]You cover your head with your hands and try to run into a thick grove of trees. But the bat circles in front of you and dives again.[/p] [p]“Stop it! Stop it!” you scream.[/p] [p]As you turn and race toward some low bushes, you remember the stories – the horrible stories about bats making nests in people's hair. And the only way to get them out was to shave your head… .[/p] [p]Those stories weren't true – were they?[/p] [p]You spot a big stick in the wet dirt and scoop it up.[/p] [p]The bat swoops down at you once more and – [em]FWAP![/em] You hit it.[/p] [p]The bat falls to the ground.[/p] [p]And you see it's on a wire.[/p] [p]It's a mechanical bat.[/p] [p]All part of the ride, you think. You think about the boat ride. Boy, they really make things seem real at this carnival, you think. You feel much better when you gaze up ahead. There's a clearing.[/p] [p]But when you see what's there – you scream![/p]

[p]“Got a winner, got a winner'' the parrot squawks. “You've won twenty-five points, plus anything you want in the prize room. Step this way.”[/p] [p]Eagerly you follow the bird into a storeroom behind the booth. It's packed with the weirdest assortment of junk you've ever seen. Dusty old catalogs, stuffed rats, a collection of axes, and portraits of headless people holding their own heads![/p] [p]“So pick something. It's getting late,” the parrot says.[/p] [p]Not this garbage, you think. Then you spot a shelf of small cans with bright labels: [span class="attribute"]play and glow[/span], [span class="attribute"]CLAY SLIME[/span], and [span class="attribute"]monster BLOOD[/span]. Monster Blood? Hey, isn't that the magic stuff you read about in GOOSEBUMPS?[/p] [p]“I'll take the Monster Blood,” you decide.[/p] [p]“Excellent choice,” the parrot remarks.[/p] [p]As you quickly leave the room with your prize, you wonder, is twenty-five points enough? What do you do next?[/p]
p.next: If you want to spin again for more points

p.text: [p]You close your eyes. When you open them, your car lunges forward with a burst of speed – and you loop-the-loop. Your mouth drops open to scream, but no sound comes out.[/p] [p]Now your car starts to plunge downward – like an elevator out of control. Your heart pounds in your chest. This is the fastest and best roller coaster you've ever been on! As you near the bottom, you slow down. You begin to catch your breath. And then you see what's up ahead. A huge black hole – a tunnel![/p] [p]As you shoot toward the open mouth of the tunnel, you begin to scream again. The door of the tunnel is about to close![/p] [p][em]Snap![/em] The door comes crashing down – behind your car. You breathe out a long sigh. But now you're in a tunnel so dark that you can't see a thing.[/p] [p]Scary! But not nearly as scary as what happens next.[/p]
p.next: What happens?

p.text: [p]“Five, four, three, two, one. We have liftoff,” a mechanical voice announces.[/p] [p]To your horror, the rocket blasts off! You're slammed against the side of the capsule with hurricane force. Seconds later, you've left Earth's atmosphere.[/p] [p]A recorded message comes on: “Congratulations. You are the perfect weight for our Mars explorer. We'll be monitoring your trip and will bring you back in approximately twenty years – with a plus or minus ten-year margin of error in case something goes wrong. But do not worry. Nothing can go wrong ... go wrong ... go wrong.”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“What do you mean the magic number could save my life?” you ask Madame Zeno. But the fortune-teller doesn't answer. She stares off into space. She seems to have fallen into a deep trance.[/p] [p]You don't really believe her – these fortunetellers are all fakes, but you memorize the number anyway. [em]1-3-2, 1-3-2. I picked red instead of blue[/em], you chant to help you remember.[/p] [p]Madame Zeno puts the card back in the deck. She closes her eyes and waves you away with her jeweled hand.[/p] [p]You guess the fortune-telling is over, so you leave the tent to search for Patty and Brad.[/p] [p]You squint under the bright lights of the midway, scanning all the game booths. But you can't find them.[/p] [p]You're trying to figure out which way to go when you spot Big Al coming toward you. He's not alone. He's leading a large group of people. As they come closer, you hear that they are chanting something. What is it?[/p] [p]“[em]Play or pay. Play or pay.[/em]”[/p] [p]What does that mean?[/p]

[p]A wave of panic washes over you as the walls crumble around you. You throw your arms over your head and close your eyes.[/p] [p]Then silence. The shaking stops.[/p] [p]When you open your eyes, the room and all the costumed people have vanished. And you are outside – in the rides area! But the biggest surprise of all is that you spot Patty and Brad![/p] [p]“Boy, am I glad to see you,” you say, racing over to them. “Where have you guys been?”[/p] [p]Brad shakes his head. “You wouldn't believe the rides we were on!”[/p] [p]“We've got to get out of here before midnight,” you say. Quickly you tell your friends about the warning from the lady with the red parasol.[/p] [p]“No problem,” Patty says. “Look. I'm sure the exit is right over there past that ride called the Hall of the Mountain King.”[/p] [p]“No, it's that way – near the sign that says [span class="attribute"]Halloween express[/span],” Brad insists.[/p] [p]Which way do you think is the right way?[/p]
p.next: Halloiveen Express?
Mountain King?

p.text: [p]You are about to scream. It seems like the only sensible thing to do.[/p] [p]And then you remember the sign.[/p] [p]Reptile Petting Zoo.[/p] [p]You have an idea. It's a crazy idea, you know. But everything in this carnival is crazy.[/p] [p]You can feel the alligator's hot breath on your arm. But instead of pulling your arm back, you stretch it out![/p] [p]“What are you doing?” Patty screams.[/p] [p]Your fingers reach out. Out over the alligator's open snout to the top of his head.[/p] [p]And you pet him.[/p] [p]“Nice alligator,” you purr as you stroke his scaly head.[/p] [p]Your arm trembles, but you don't stop. And slowly – very slowly – the creature's mouth begins to shut.[/p] [p]Then he rolls over and falls asleep![/p] [p]You slip quietly off the log, charge for the shore – and plow right into Big Al![/p] [p]“Well, well, well. Look who we have here,” Big Al sings out. “Come with me. It's time for The Final Challenge.”[/p]
p.next: You have no choice. Follow Big Al.

p.text: [p]You're spinning round and round. Everything is a blur. You can't see, but you hear the crowd chanting, “FI-NAL! FI-NAL! FI-NAL!”[/p] [p]And then the wheel stops.[/p] [p]A huge gasp escapes from the audience.[/p] [p]Did you win or lose?[/p] [p]Neither. You stopped on [span class="attribute"]spin again[/span].[/p]

[p]The giant looms over you. He's as tall as the tree outside your house – and a lot meaner. His huge lips part and he says, “You hurt my feelings.”[/p] [p]Then he begins to cry.[/p] [p]“I am not a wimp. I am not,” he says between huge sobs.[/p] [p]He sure looks like a wimp.[/p]
[p]You're falling … falling … everything passes as if you're dropping in slow motion. Is this …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p] [p class="end"]Yes.[/p]

[p]The tracks stretch up so high that they seem to touch the clouds. Your gaze follows one of the cars speeding around a sharp curve. It looks like the space shuttle. You notice that it has a safety harness that locks over your body – you've seen those before. They keep you in when the ride turns upside down. You didn't want to admit it before, but, like Brad, riding upside down is not your favorite thing.[/p] [p]Still, the coaster does look amazing – one part enters a tunnel – and you can see that the cars go fast. Really fast![/p] [p]You're just about to walk through the Space Coaster gate when you hear spooky organ music coming from behind you. You turn around. Looming in the distance is a dark and creepy haunted house.[/p] [p]You gaze down at your map. It's called the Little House of Horrors. Hmmm. You love haunted houses. And this one really looks scary.[/p] [p]Now you're not sure what to do. You won't have time for everything. The coaster or the haunted house? Decide now.[/p]
p.next: If you decide to join Patty and Brad on the Space Coaster
If you want to go to the House of Horrors alone

p.text: [p]“Come on!” Patty cries. “Come on!”[/p] [p]Then, without another word, she races off. You and Brad dash after her.[/p] [p]I hope Patty knows what she's doing, you think as you try to catch up. Because right now, it doesn't look that way.[/p] [p]Patty leads you through a maze of underground passageways. Then, just as you're about to yell, “Stop!” – she does. And you find yourself standing outside, in front of a barbed-wire fence![/p] [p]Up ahead, you spot an opening.[/p] [p]“Let's go in!” Patty says.[/p] [p]The three of you creep through the fence and trudge through some tall, wet grass. You gaze around. It's way too dark to see.[/p] [p]But you can hear perfectly. And the sounds that reach your ears make your skin crawl.[/p] [p]Slithering. You definitely hear slithering.[/p] [p]And hissing.[/p] [p]You want to leave. You spin around, but you can't find the opening in the fence! You do see something else. A sign![/p]
p.next: Hurry on

p.text: [p]The wheel stops on [span class="attribute"]free spin[/span]. You are ready to try again. But the dumb parrot flies over and latches onto your shoulder.[/p] [p]“Ouch! That hurts,” you cry.[/p] [p]“Free spin, free spin, you're going on a free spin.”[/p] [p]“Turn me loose,” you command. When you swivel your head to glare at the bird, a scream freezes in your throat. The parrot has ballooned into an enormous vulture. His black, beady eyes pierce right through you. He digs his razor-sharp claws deeper into your shoulder.[/p] [p]Run! – your every survival instinct shouts. But the bird of prey has other ideas. One of them is dinner – with you as the main course.[/p] [p]The big bird snatches you by the back of your shirt as if you were a rag doll. Kicking and screaming and using every defensive move you learned from karate class, you struggle for your life. But it's no use. With a jerk he lifts you off the ground.[/p] [p]And suddenly you have a frightening view of the carnival from twenty feet… thirty feet … fifty feet up.[/p]
p.next: Fly on

p.text: [p][em]Thummp, thump, thump.[/em] Your heart bangs loudly inside your chest. What kind of carnival is this, you wonder, where a free spin is more like a death sentence?[/p] [p]You circle a green clump of treetops. You're really dizzy now. You want to close your eyes. But you know it's not a good idea – since you're flying fifty feet high without a plane or a parachute.[/p] [p]As you circle closer to the treetops, you are met with a horrifying view. Five baby vultures in a nest, five very hungry babies, with mouths gaping wide open.[/p] [p]The end is near. You are going to wind up as a take-home dinner. Unless you can somehow force the vulture to let you go. Frantically, you reach into your pockets![/p]

[p]You can't take on both monsters, so you decide to wait until one of them leaves the room.[/p] [p]You grab hold of Dr. Stone's hand. He's a lot stronger than he looks. With one small tug, he pulls you free of the web.[/p] [p]Then he turns to the monsters. “Okay,” he barks. “Adjust the net. It's time to practice spiking.”[/p] [p]Spiking? What does he mean by that?[/p] [p]The monsters leap up. They rub their hands together in evil delight. Then they untie the net and head to the back of the room, where two huge poles rest on the floor.[/p] [p]You close your eyes – and hope that when you open them, you'll see that this was all a dream. A really bad dream.[/p] [p]But when you open your eyes, you know it's not a dream. No – it's a volleyball game. The net has been tied to the poles – and guess what position you play? That's right. You're the ball! Watch out for those two-handed spikes! They can be pretty painful![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Just as the clock strikes twelve, the train enters a tunnel.[/p] [p]You hold your breath, wondering what you'll see when you reach the other end.[/p] [p][em]Chug. Chug. Chug.[/em][/p] [p]The choo-choo slowly pulls out of the tunnel – and you are surrounded by carnival workers – everywhere![/p]

[p]Oh, no! You think the space lady guessed right! Now what's going to happen?[/p] [p]The two guards shove you into the space chamber.[/p] [p]It's a clear, narrow tube that rises farther up than you can see.[/p] [p]As the door slams shut behind you, one of the guards barks, “Get on the scale!”[/p] [p]You step up on the scale – and it shows just how right the space lady's guess was.[/p] [p]You press the chamber-door release, but it's stuck.[/p] [p]You try again. It doesn't budge.[/p] [p]Maybe it's locked from the outside.[/p] [p]“Hey! I can't get out!” you yell to the guards. But they simply wave.[/p] [p]“Hey, let me out!” Now you're mad. “Let me out!”[/p] [p]All at once the room starts to shake and rattle. [em]RRRRRRRR[/em]. The thrust of powerful rocket engines echoes in your ears. It sounds as if you're being launched into space. But that's impossible, isn't it?[/p]

[p]Your Halloween Express car pulls up in front of a cottage and the cottage door opens with a creak. You all jerk your heads up to peer at the door. You see a skeleton wearing an evil smile. And he lunges right for [em]you![/em][/p] [p]“Trick or treat!” he screeches. Then he stretches out his bony hands to snatch you![/p] [p]You pound on the gas pedal, and the car shoots forward – out of the skeleton's grasp![/p] [p]Your heart begins to race as the car speeds out of control. You tear through an eerie forest, speed past more cottages – but still you don't see a way out.[/p] [p]And then it comes into view – a service exit![/p] [p]All you have to do is stop the car, jump out, and scramble through the fence, and you'll be free.[/p] [p]You check your watch – five minutes to midnight![/p] [p]“Oh, no!” Patty screams. “Quick, turn left! Don't stop!”[/p]
p.next: Turn left!

p.text: [p]They're dummies. That's why they don't move![/p] [p]‘They've got to be here somewhere,” you hear Big Al's voice boom outside the tent.[/p] [p]“Hey! This dummy looks just like the one in that GOOSEBUMPS book,” Patty says.[/p] [p]“You mean [em]Night of the Living Dummy?!”[/em] Brad asks.[/p] [p]Great! you think. Your friends are chatting about books minutes before you're about to be attacked by a mob. Then you get an idea.[/p] [p]“Remember those magic words that brought the dummy to life in that book?” you ask your friends. “Maybe we can bring this guy to life and he'll help us – he [em]was[/em] pretty tough.”[/p] [p]Your friends agree – it's worth a try.[/p]
p.next: If you think the words are harm marri odonna loma molonu kairano
If you think the words are oooopah lupah dummie dupah

p.text: [p]You leap out of the boat. The putrid brown water splashes into your mouth. Gross![/p] [p]You swim a few strokes and suddenly find your knees scraping the bottom of the bog. The water here is less than a foot deep. Unbelievable! You were practically inches away from safety the entire time![/p] [p]Slogging through the brown foam, you wade to shore. Your clothes are dripping wet and smell like a sewer. Well, look at the bright side, you remind yourself. At least you didn't go down with your boat.[/p] [p]But your troubles aren't over yet. You're standing in a dank, eerie forest that surrounds the lake. Creepy screeches echo through the night mist. And you're totally lost.[/p] [p]The wind starts to blow. Shivering, you wrap your arms around your shoulders and wonder where your friends are and what they are doing.[/p] [p]Then – [em]POW![/em] Something black and furry swoops down at you! You duck your head, but it comes at you again and again.[/p] [p]A huge bat![/p]

[p]You open the blue door and peer through. You're staring down a long dark passageway. At least you think it's long. It's difficult to tell. It's pitch-black. You don't know what to do.[/p] [p]“Maybe I should have picked the other door'' you say to yourself. “I'm getting out of here!”[/p] [p]But the blue door has locked behind you! Now you're sure you made the wrong choice. But there's nowhere to go but forward.[/p] [p]Your knees begin to tremble as you inch your way down the dark hallway.[/p] [p]The passage ends in a bright burst of light. And in front of you, a tall purple mountain rises hundreds of feet into the air.[/p] [p]You breathe out a long sigh of relief. You're out of the dark![/p] [p]You study the mountain. It looks so real! But cut into its side, you spot a doorway. Above it a brightly painted sign reads: [span class="attribute"]doom slide. will YOU BE THE ONE TO SLIDE FOREVER?[/span][/p]

[p]Steel bars plunge down from above and drop across your lap and chest, pinning you in place. You can't move at all. Even your head is held by super-strong headphones that clamp over your ears. A voice comes through them announcing: “Five, four, three, two, one, BLAST OFF!”[/p] [p]You hear a huge bang. Smoke and fireworks fill the air as your car starts up the first big hill. Your head presses back against the seat as you climb higher and higher. That first hill is endless, but the view is awesome. From the top, you can see the midway, the haunted house, and a shadowy swamp. You can't believe how big the carnival is! “Neat!” Patty yells. “There's AHHHH – ” Whatever she was going to say turns into a wild scream as the rocket plunges down the other side of the hill. The wind whips at your face. You are pressed back so hard, you feel like a pancake. Everything passes in a fantastic blur.[/p] [p]As your car shoots up to the top of the next hill, you're laughing and screaming at the same time. This is great, you think! But then you make a big mistake.[/p]

[p]Blue is your favorite color. You turn the blue card over.[/p] [p]There is a message: [em]Help us! You are our only hope. Hurry to the back door of the freak show. Signed, The Freaks.[/em][/p] [p]“What does this mean?” you ask Madame Zeno. She stares deep into your eyes. Her lips tremble. She leans forward. She's about to speak.[/p] [p]And then the lights go out – and a bloodcurdling scream rips through the dark![/p] [p]You start to bolt for the door when a dim light suddenly flickers. You stare across the table. Madame Zeno is gone![/p] [p]You reach out to take the card. And it bursts into red-hot flames! In seconds, the entire tent fills with thick smoke. Flames shoot across the floor. You run for the door.[/p] [p]Outside you gulp the fresh air. Whew! You made it.[/p] [p]You glance back. No smoke. No fire. No tent! Everything has disappeared! What should you do now?[/p]
p.next: If you decide to help the freaks
If you don't want to help the freaks

p.text: [p]“There's a sign!” you call out to Patty and Brad. “Let's see what it says.”[/p] [p]The three of you race through the wet grass. Your socks are drenched. And your sneakers squeak as you run. But that's not the sound that's sending chills down your spine.[/p] [p]It's the hissing. It's growing louder.[/p] [p]“I'm not sure I want to read that sign,” you call out to Patty and Brad.[/p] [p]“I know what you mean!” Patty shouts back. “I have a feeling we're not going to like what it says.”[/p] [p]And you don't. You reach the sign and read it aloud. “Reptile Petting Zoo! Whoever heard of a Reptile Petting Zoo! What kind of carnival is this anyway?”[/p] [p]“This carnival is e-evil,” Brad stammers.[/p] [p]You're about to agree when you notice the grass in front of you is swaying. Something is slithering through it. Something big. And then it comes into view.[/p] [p]“Snake!” Brad cries.[/p] [p]You know you have to run – but which way? Left or right?[/p]
p.next: If you run to the left
If you run to the right

p.text: [p]You're too scared to turn around. And too scared not to. Risking a glance over your shoulder, you see a large, dark shape behind you. It's a big man. No. You squint hard. It's dark and hairy with muddy leaves and green vines trailing from its body. It's some sort of swamp monster![/p] [p]You run as fast as you can. Your chest is on fire. The swamp monster is gaining on you.[/p] [p]You know you should keep running, but your heart feels as if it's about to explode. You have to stop.[/p] [p]You turn and stare light into the swamp monster's bloody eyes. “Neat costume,” you say hopefully.[/p] [p]Good try – but the swamp monster isn't wearing a costume. He's real and this, unfortunately, is really …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You decide to wait for Big Al.[/p] [p]“Big Al has to free the freaks,” you say to Patty and Brad. “If he doesn't, we'll tell him we're calling the police!”[/p] [p]“Free the freaks?” Big Al says, bursting into the room. “The freaks are free to go any time. This prison is just part of the show. Did you pull that `free us’ joke on him?” Big Al laughs heartily.[/p] [p]“He'ssss lying,” the Snake Lady says. “We're prisonersssss.”[/p] [p]“Oh, come now,” Big Al says. “You're not prisoners.” And with that he unlocks all the cell doors. Then he turns to you and your friends.[/p] [p]“As you can see, the freaks are free. Now, come with me. You haven't even tried one game on the midway.”[/p] [p]“Don't go with him. It's a trick!” the Snake Lady cries.[/p] [p]Should you go with Big Al?[/p] [p]Who's telling the truth? Al or the Snake Lady?[/p]
p.next: If you want to go with Al
If you trust the Snake Lady

p.text: [p][em]Bump.[/em][/p] [p]A chute opens up. You land headfirst on soft grass.[/p] [p]You blink several times. A long sigh escapes from your lips. It wasn't the Doom Slide after all.[/p] [p]As you climb to your feet you hear someone call your name.[/p] [p]You glance up and shout for joy. It's Brad! And Patty's there, too![/p] [p]You tell them about your scary ride on the slide – about how you thought you'd slide forever.[/p] [p]“Cool!” Patty exclaims. “Let's all ride it this time!”[/p] [p]“No!” you tell her. “This carnival is too weird. And dangerous. Something's not right. We have to get out of here. Now!”[/p] [p]“Yeah,” Brad agrees. “The faster, the better.”[/p] [p]“I have an idea,” Patty announces. You and Brad huddle around her. “I spotted a back way out of here. But it's a little risky. We have to squeeze through a barbed-wire fence – and it's guarded by the carnival's security forces. But we should try!”[/p] [p]Are you going to listen to Patty?[/p]
p.next: Follow Patty?
You choose [em]not[/em] to take the back way out?

p.text: [p]The House of Horrors! You have to see it. You just have to![/p] [p]“I'll catch up with you guys later'' you call to Patty and Brad. “I'm going to check out the haunted house.”[/p] [p]You glance down at your map for directions. The rickety wooden bridge over to your left appears to lead straight there.[/p] [p]As you start across the bridge, the wooden planks creak under your feet. Then the bridge begins to sway. You look down. Way down. The bridge spans a deep, rocky gorge. Gulping, you grab the handrail. You move slowly. A strong wind blows up from the canyon below'. The bridge is swaying wildly now, tossing from side to side.[/p] [p]A massive spear of lightning splits the sky. Thunder rumbles so loudly you jump and lose your balance. “Help!" you scream as you tumble right over the side – and plunge toward the jagged rocks below![/p] [p]How can you save yourself?[/p]
p.next: Make a grab for the side of the bridge?
Flap your arms and try to fly?

p.text: [p]The walls are closing in faster now.[/p] [p]You throw your arms out and try to push them away. But it's hopeless. You're going to be crushed like a bug.[/p] [p]You suck in a deep breath – it could be the last breath you take.[/p] [p]The floor opens beneath your feet![/p] [p]You drop down. Down. Down. Down. A long, agonizing scream escapes from your throat as you tumble through space.[/p] [p]Will you ever hit bottom?[/p] [p]“Incoming player,” you hear a commanding voice shout. “Stations, everybody.”[/p] [p]A layer of webbing catches you like one of those nets trapeze artists use. Gasping, unable to understand what's happening, you bounce up and down.[/p]

[p]You start up the brick path to the House of Horrors. Suddenly someone sneaks up behind you and taps you on the shoulder. You spin around and jump back.[/p] [p]Standing in front of you is a bony skeleton.[/p] [p]And it talks.[/p] [p]“Don't go in there,” the skeleton says. “Or you'll end up like me… .”[/p] [p]You stare in terror at the hideous creature. Then you burst out laughing.[/p] [p]“Wow! You guys really want to make the haunted house totally creepy. This is going to be great!” you say.[/p] [p]You're still chuckling as you push open the giant oak door of the House of Horrors. It swings back with a long, loud creak.[/p] [p]You step inside and find yourself in a narrow hallway. The door slams shut behind you and the hall turns darker than a starless night. “I can't even see my hands!” you exclaim.[/p] [p]You stumble ahead slowly, pressing your palms against the walls to guide you.[/p] [p]When will this tunnel end?[/p]
p.next: Look for a way out

p.text: [p][em]Thrumpff![/em] Your foot plows into the doctor's stomach again. But this time, it smashes right through it. And hits … solid steel![/p] [p]The crunch of metal echoes in the room – along with the doctor's screams. “Aiiii!” he wails like a siren.[/p] [p]You gaze into the gaping hole your sneaker made. Thousands of circuits and wires burn and crackle inside it. The doctor is a robot! Well, an ex-robot now. Your kick totally destroyed him.[/p] [p]That's the good news.[/p] [p]The bad news is headed for you. It's the monster with the blue horns and red, bulging eyes.[/p] [p]You scramble out of the net and dash toward the door. But the monster is too quick for you. His tentacle arms shoot out and snatch you. Giant suckers at the ends of his wrists circle your throat.[/p] [p]You gasp for air as the monster pins you against the wall. Can you free yourself from his oozing grasp?[/p]

[p]You slowly lower yourself onto the slide. You start to stretch out your legs when the bottom tilts underneath you and throws you forward. You're sliding! Fast![/p] [p]The surface must be made of some kind of special material because you're zooming down at top speed.[/p] [p]You hold your breath as you fly through the blackness. A bump sends you bouncing into the air. You scream. And scream.[/p] [p]When is it going to end?[/p] [p]Oh, no! Could this be the Doom Slide?[/p] [p]You hear screams echo in the darkness. You twist around. But you don't see anyone.[/p] [p]The ghostly screams grow louder – in front of you, next to you, behind you. Screaming and sliding. And sliding. Never stopping.[/p] [p]You gasp for breath. And then you hear it.[/p] [p]A voice cuts through the blackness. Through the screams. A voice that cries, “Welcome to the rest of your life. Welcome to the Doom Slide!”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Karru marri odonna loma molonu karrano.” You say the magic words and – the dummy comes to life![/p] [p]He opens his mouth and speaks. '‘Hey, you. Your face reminds me of a wart I once had removed.”[/p] [p]“Come on,” you plead. “We're the ones who brought you back to life. Aren't you going to be nice to us? We need your help.”[/p] [p]“I'm sorry,” the dummy says. “I'm sorry you're so ugly …'' Then he laughs at his own lame joke.[/p] [p]You stare at him and his face grows serious. “You brought me to life,” he says slowly, “but now you are my slaves.[/p] [p]“Forever – until …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

have.text: [p][em]Wait! This isn't the way this is supposed to end. Quick – you have one last chance.[/em][/p]

userInput.label: What secret number did the fortuneteller tell you?

p.text: [p]“Nine … ten . .[/p] [p]“Brad, shut up. Look at this!”[/p] [p]You point to the letters on the front of the train car.[/p] [p]You've been staring at them the entire time. Why didn't you notice them before?[/p] [p]“What about the letters?” Patty says sharply.[/p] [p]“Eleven …”[/p] [p]“Don't you see what they say?” you shoot back.[/p] [p]“Right-Way Railroad,” Patty reads. “So what?”[/p] [p]The chants of the merry-go-round people echo in your head. [em]There's only one right way. There's only one right way.[/em][/p] [p]Could it be?[/p] [p]“Twelve!”[/p] [p]Now what?[/p]

[p]Sorry. It's not your lucky day. As you dash toward the sign, the giant crane scoops the three of you up and drops you off into a hollowed-out log. You barely have time to sit up straight before the craft reaches the waterfall![/p] [p]You hold your breath as the log teeters on the fall's edge. As it plunges over, you scream.[/p] [p]A hard spray smacks you in the face and drenches your clothing as you race down the long slide. At the bottom, the log hits a pool of water and sinks.[/p] [p]You're still holding your breath as you wait to bob to the surface again. But it never happens. You keep going down.[/p] [p]Your last thought is that you're going to set a world's record for holding your breath underwater.[/p] [p]You'd better set a world's record for closing the book and starting over again. Maybe next time you dive in you'll have better luck.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You step up to the Guess Your Weight on Mars booth. A woman in a space suit motions you inside a gate. You pass through and find yourself in the middle of a courtyard that looks just like a miniature launching site – complete with its own rocket![/p] [p]“Security check,” the lady says as she presses your hand onto a fake scanner.[/p] [p]“So how does this game work?” you ask.[/p] [p]‘Til guess how much you weigh on Mars,” she explains. “Then you'll enter the planet simulation chamber and stand on the scale. If I'm stumped by more than one pound up or down, you win a giant candy bar.”[/p] [p]“What if you guess right?”[/p] [p]The space lady doesn't say anything at first. She just smiles. A nasty smile. Then she answers. “You lose,” is all she says.[/p]

[p]Your reflexes are great. You jumped out fast enough and escaped the ghost – [em]that[/em] ghost. But you didn't see the other one behind the car – waiting for you.[/p] [p]Your heart hammers away in your chest as it circles you. Around and around and around.[/p] [p]“It's all right,” you tell yourself over and over. “It's not real. This is just a ride in an amusement park.”[/p] [p]You're still telling yourself that as the ghost plucks you off your feet.[/p] [p]His black lips part.[/p] [p]He opens his mouth – wider and wider. Until it's as wide as an entrance to a cave.[/p] [p]Then he stuffs you inside.[/p] [p]Instantly you feel lightheaded, then light all over. You peek down at your hands.[/p] [p]You can see straight through them. You've been turned into a ghost! And as your senses fade, you hear a distant bell chime twelve times. Too bad. The Carnival of Horrors will be one of your favorite haunts – forever![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Round and round you go. The world is a blur of colors. You can hear the crowd screaming. “FINAL! FI-NAL!”[/p] [p]And the wheel stops.[/p] [p]“Ahhhhhh,” the crowd gasps.[/p] [p]What does it mean?[/p] [p]“YOU WIN,” Big Al says. “Now come this way to collect your prize and go home.”[/p]

[p]The three of you duck inside the Hall of the Mountain King![/p] [p]A painted backdrop of rounded snowcapped mountains rises on your left. Up in the mountains a big stone castle rests in the sunshine. A group of cheerful elves pick flowers in the castle's garden.[/p] [p]To your right, you spot the ride – wooden carts pulled by real horses. “Come on!” you call to your friends. “Jump in a cart. This is great. We'll be out of here in no time.” No time – that reminds you. You glance at your watch. 11:45![/p] [p]You all scramble into one of the carts and grab the reins. Your horse plods forward, and you pass through a painted stone archway.[/p] [p]You gasp. Everything in the painted backdrop is now in front of you. And it has suddenly become real. But different![/p] [p]The snowcapped mountains rise to black, jagged peaks that pierce the sky. The big stone castle huddles on a scary, dark hill. And the elves – they aren't picking flowers.[/p] [p]They're …[/p]

[p]You dig deep into the side pocket of your jeans – and find it! The chocolate bar you won.[/p] [p]It's a good thing you didn't eat it all – but will the vulture go for it?[/p] [p]Without warning, the big bird starts his final approach, diving straight for the nest. You pull out the candy and wave it frantically in front of him. “Treat! Treat!” you holler. These words make your dog at home go wild. But will it work on the vulture?[/p] [p]Yes! He cracks open his beak – just enough for you to wiggle loose. Then you're falling, falling.[/p] [p]You've landed on a giant trampoline.[/p] [p][em]Fwanggg![/em][/p] [p]Now you're going up again. Higher this time. Now you're falling again.[/p] [p][em]Fwanggg[/em] – you've bounced up even higher this time.[/p] [p]Every life has its ups and downs, but it looks as if you'll be bouncing up and down forever – and boy, is it fun![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Let's head for the midway and play some games!” you say.[/p] [p]You, Patty, and Brad jog down a wide avenue. Tents of every color line the street. Carnival music blares from loudspeakers.[/p] [p]You spot a green neon sign flashing above a yellow-striped tent. The sign reads: [span class="attribute"]madame ZENO – FORTUNE-TELLER[/span].[/p] [p]“Excellent!” you exclaim. “I'm going in!”[/p] [p]You tell your friends you'll catch up with them in a minute.[/p] [p]You lift the tent flap. Inside, one small candle flickers in the dark. You hear a low voice call out, “Enter my chamber.”[/p] [p]There is Madame Zeno, sitting in the shadows. She wears a long red dress dotted with brightly colored gems. They shimmer in the candlelight. Her black hair tumbles to her shoulders as she bends over a large crystal ball.[/p] [p]“Welcome,” she whispers. Then she reaches out and gently lifts your hand. “Let me tell you your future.”[/p]

[p]Madame Zeno studies your hand closely. She traces the lines in your hand with her soft fingers.[/p] [p]“I see horror in your future. In your [em]immediate[/em] future,” she warns.[/p] [p]“Wh-what kind of horror?” you stammer. “What do you mean?”[/p] [p]Madame Zeno releases your hand. She picks up a strange deck of cards. She spreads them out on the table. You notice the cards have pictures – a headless man, a bloody sword, a large, evil eye.[/p] [p]She gathers up all the cards and flips the deck over. Then she deals out a red card and a blue card.[/p] [p]“Turn one over,” she commands. “Learn your fate.”[/p]
p.next: Pick red?
Pick blue?

p.text: [p]The doctor leans over. He's so close now, his sour breath fills your nostrils. Then his fingertips brush your hand and – [em]POW![/em] Your foot flies into his stomach! A direct hit![/p] [p]But nothing happens.[/p] [p]He doesn't scream. He doesn't even moan. In fact, he doesn't seem to notice at all.[/p] [p]He simply smiles at you.[/p] [p]Now you're scared. Really scared. But you know you have to do whatever it takes to get out of there. You have to find your friends and escape from this Carnival of Horrors.[/p] [p]You gather up every ounce of courage and strength you have – and kick him once more. Harder![/p] [p]And this time something does happen – BIG TIME![/p]

[p]You turn a corner and are instantly blinded by glaring lights.[/p] [p]You are standing in a room of mirrors. Walls. Floor. Ceiling. All mirrors![/p] [p]Everywhere you gaze, you are met with reflections of yourself! You take a few steps forward and – [em]BONK![/em] You hit your head on solid glass.[/p] [p]You move one step to the left, and a dozen copies of you move in that direction.[/p] [p]Totally dizzy, you close your eyes. Maybe you can find the exit with your hands. Keeping your eyes shut, you walk until your palms hit against another glass wall. Then you hear a voice. “Come this way. Over here,” it calls.[/p] [p]You walk toward the voice – [em]BONK[/em] – a solid wall again.[/p] [p]Finally your hands find an open doorway! It leads to a mirrored hallway that goes left and right. Which way will you go?[/p]
p.next: If you decide to turn right
If you decide to turn left

p.text: [p]“You're lying!” you yell. “You [em]are[/em] a robot.”[/p] [p]You quickly reach up with both hands and tug at his head. His sharp jaws slash at you. But you're fast. You hold on firmly and pull![/p] [p]Oh, no! He really is a monster. And he's not happy.[/p] [p]You knowr you're dead meat, but you have to try one more time. Just to make sure. You give his head one more tug. He laughs. Then he gives [em]your[/em] head a tug.[/p] [p]Sorry. You were doing so well. But now you've gone and lost your head. The only way you'll be able to face the challenge of the Carnival of Horrors now is to close the book and begin another day. At least then – you'll have a head start.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Oooopah lupah dummie dupah.” You say the magic words and wait for the dummy to spring to life.[/p] [p]And you wait.[/p] [p]And you wait.[/p] [p]The dummy remains the same.[/p] [p]But something strange is happening to you. What are those feathers sprouting out of your skin? And what's happening to your feet? Are those claws you see growing out of them?[/p] [p]Is it possible that the magic words are turning you – [em]CLUCK[/em] – into a – [em]CLUCK[/em] – chicken?[/p] [p]That's eggs-actly what's happening.[/p] [p]Well, you laid an egg this time. Let's hope you won't be too chicken to open this book again and try once more to escape from the Carnival of Horrors.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You squint hard at the road ahead of you – and see why Patty wants you to turn. There they are – the people in the old-fashioned clothes. Only they don't look the same.[/p] [p]Some have green flesh. Some are deathly white. Their rotting skin hangs from their bones.[/p] [p]And they're all reaching out. Reaching out for you![/p] [p]“Turn! Turn!” Patty yells.[/p] [p]You spin the wheel sharply to the left to avoid them. But you can't dodge the ghostly creature that's rising above you. He's ten feet tall – with arms so long that they scrape the ground. His mouth gapes open to reveal hundreds of blackened, rotting teeth.[/p] [p]He swoops down at you. You turn the steering wheel hard to the right. Too hard – it comes off in your hands![/p] [p]“Jump!” you cry. “Jump and run! Run!”[/p] [p]The three of you leap out of the moving car. But are you fast enough? That depends on how good your reflexes are.[/p] [p]Try this test and find out. Throw a ball in the air. Try to clap three times before your catch it.[/p]
p.next: If you can do it
If you couldn't

p.text: [p]Big Al shoves you and your friends into a huge red tent. It seems to be set up for some kind of show. Red carpeted steps lead up to a platform, which sits under a golden arch. The arch twinkles with a thousand colored lights that spell out: FINAL CHALLENGE.[/p] [p]Trumpets blast as people flood into the viewing area. As they march in, they clap their hands and yell, “FI-NAL. FI-NAL.”[/p] [p]Big Al leads you up the carpeted steps. You are standing on the platform now – in front of a shimmering curtain that hangs down from the arch.[/p] [p]The crowd begins to chant, “SUD-DEN DEATH. SUD-DEN DEATH.”[/p] [p]“What do you think [em]that[/em] means?” Patty asks.[/p]

[p]The giant hangs over you, flexing his muscles. He squints at you as if you are a bug – ready to be squashed.[/p] [p]“Did you call me a wimp?” he thunders.[/p] [p]You are much too scared to answer.[/p] [p]The giant answers for you. “You're right. I am a wimp!”[/p] [p]And with that, he bends the bars, and you, Patty, and Brad scramble through.[/p] [p]“Follow me,” the giant says. “I know a way out of here.”[/p] [p]“What about the others?” you ask, pointing to the freaks in the cells that line the wall.[/p] [p]“No problem!” Patty yells, grabbing the keys from a hook on the wall. “Here – catch!”[/p] [p]You quickly unlock all the doors – setting the freaks free![/p]

[p]“I don't know,” you say. “I don't think we should take any more risks. Especially not in this crazy carnival.”[/p] [p]“Don't you trust me?” Patty demands. Her eyes flash angrily.[/p] [p]You glance at Brad. He stares at the ground.[/p] [p]“I just have a bad feeling about this, Patty.[/p] [p]Okay?”[/p] [p]But Patty doesn't answer. She throws her shoulders back and stands up taller. And taller. And taller.[/p] [p]You gasp! Patty is growing! She's nearly ten feet tall![/p] [p]She reaches out a long arm and grabs you by the wrist. Her nails dig deep into your skin.[/p] [p]You can't move.[/p] [p]You scream as Patty continues to change. Her skin turns green and lumpy. Horns sprout from her head. And her teeth grow into sharp fangs.[/p] [p]You remember the horrible monsters on the walls of the slide. Patty has turned into one of them![/p] [p]“Let me go. Please!” you plead.[/p] [p]“Too bad you didn't trust me,” she growls. “I can't have you ruining my plans.” Her nails sink deeper into your flesh.[/p] [p]“Ha-ha-ha!” she cackles. Then she wraps her slimy mouth around your arm and bites down. Hard![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You're staring at a sign that reads: [span class="attribute"]world's freakiest freak show![/span] The three of you gape at the pictures.[/p] [p]There's the Three-Headed Man with the ugliest collection of faces you've ever seen. And the Snake Lady – a young blond girl with a beautiful face and the body of a slithering snake.[/p] [p]“This is, uh – uh – ” you start to say. But you don't finish. Because a large hand has come down on your shoulder. Hard.[/p] [p]You slowly turn and gaze up at a huge man with shoulders wider than a refrigerator. He has coal-black eyes with a thick mustache to match. He looks strong enough – and mean enough – to pitch you over the fence with one hand.[/p] [p]“What are you doing?” his deep voice booms. “You're not allowed in here,” he says, pointing directly at [em]you[/em].[/p] [p]“We're sorry,” you say, hoping you appear sorry and not just scared. “We wanted to look around. That's all. But we'll leave. Right now.”[/p] [p]His eyes stare into yours. He clamps both hands down on your shoulders and says, “You're not going anywhere!”[/p]

[p]You head toward the Boat Trip to Nowhere. At the dock, you spot a stubby guy with long arms slouching against one of the mooring posts. In the strange light of the swamp, his skin shines with an oily, green glow. And his ears and nose are as craggy as tree bark.[/p] [p]“Step right up,” he calls in a gravelly voice.[/p] [p]He pulls one of the motorboats over. It's red with a silver racing stripe! “You can do fifteen knots in these babies,” he says. “But stay away from the tree stumps.”[/p] [p]You watch the little man's sharp green fingernails tearing the mooring rope apart. As soon as the boat is free, you jump in, step on the gas, and roar away from the dock.[/p] [p]The wind blows hard against your face. You're flying over the water. This is totally cool! You head for a channel that you see up ahead. Too bad you didn't notice that sign that reads: [span class="attribute"]TO BOOGER BOG[/span].[/p]

[p]Dr. Stone extends a long bony hand to pull you from the net. When you peer into his face, his eyes roll up into his head.[/p] [p]“Pleased to meet you,” he rumbles.[/p] [p]Did he say, “Pleased to meet you” or “Pleased to eat you”? You're not sure, and you don't want to hang around to find out.[/p] [p]I've got to get out of here, you think.[/p] [p]As the doctor lowers his hand a bit more, you wriggle your right foot free of the netting. If you give him one hard kick in the stomach, maybe you can make a run for the door.[/p] [p]But what about the monsters? Can you dodge them?[/p] [p]You change your mind. “I'll wait – play it cool until at least one of the beasts leaves the room,” you say to yourself.[/p] [p]Then you change your mind again. “No. I'd better make my escape now!”[/p] [p]The doctor looms inches away. And you're still not sure what to do. You'd better decide fast![/p]
p.next: Try to kick the doctor and run?
Wait until one of the monsters leaves and the odds are better than three against one?

p.text: [p]NO![/p] [p]At the last minute, you wrench the steering wheel hard to the left. The side of your boat clears the tree with a sickening scrape.[/p] [p]You breathe a sigh of relief, but it ends in a groan. A huge, sharp root below the water has just ripped into the bottom of your boat. You hear a tearing sound, then gurgling as the cockpit starts to fill with water.[/p] [p]“Now what?” you mutter.[/p] [p]Then through the mist you spot another boat. But it's some distance away.[/p] [p]“Hey, over here!” you cry out.[/p] [p]Did they hear you? You cry out again. Then you glance behind you. More than half your boat is underwater – and you're going down fast.[/p] [p]What should you do? Keep yelling for help? Or try to swim for safety? Make your choice – QUICK![/p]
p.next: If you decide to wait to be rescued
If you decide to swim for it

p.text: [p]The red-eyed beast leans against you now, pressing you hard against the wall. The monster moves his face close to yours. The jagged horns at the top of his head nick your cheeks.[/p] [p]You can't bear it anymore. You bring your hand up with all your might and shove his head away from yours.[/p] [p]As you watch in horror, the monster's head rolls off its neck. The head tumbles to the floor and lands at your feet.[/p] [p]The eyes glance up at you, and you notice his hideous lips moving. “That hurt,” the head says. “That really h-h- ...”[/p] [p]He never finishes. You've destroyed another robot![/p] [p]“Almost out of here,” you whisper to yourself. Now all you have to do is slip by the crusty, alligator-snout creature guarding the door.[/p] [p]“You robots aren't so tough,” you say to him with fake bravery.[/p] [p]“Oh, really?” the scaly beast croaks. “Well, maybe not. But what makes you think that [em]I[/em] am a robot?”[/p]

[p]You decide to wait. Someone should be here soon, you think. But after waiting in the space shuttle for at least fifteen minutes, you're not so sure. No one has shown up to rescue you.[/p] [p]A chill runs down your back. You feel as if a thousand pairs of eyes are watching you from the shadows.[/p] [p]Now that you're accustomed to the darkness, you can see dozens of tracks leading in and out of the tunnel.[/p] [p]And then you hear a rustling sound. You freeze. You listen hard. Could it be rats – or something worse?[/p] [p]You draw up your knees and wrap your arms around them tightly. Then you hear a hissing sound – and you smell something odd. It's kind of a sweet smell – like heavy perfume. You hold your nose because the smell is making you feel strange. Dizzy. Sick.[/p]
p.next: Hold your breath

p.text: [p]What a sight![/p] [p]You can hardly believe your eyes! You scream again.[/p] [p]It's Patty and Brad![/p] [p]“Hey guys, wait up!” you yell.[/p]
p.next: Quick! Hurry, and you can go on the Space Coaster with them.

p.text: [p]The ride stops.[/p] [p]Dead.[/p] [p]You are sitting in the dark.[/p] [p]Nothing is moving.[/p] [p]“Patty! Brad!” you call.[/p] [p]Silence.[/p] [p]Why don't they answer? They have to be there.[/p] [p]You try to twist around. But you're locked in your harness and clamped in your headrest.[/p] [p]Blinking in the dim light, your eyes dart to the left. Then to the right. You spot dozens of empty space rockets lining the walls. They seem to come in sections – to make longer and shorter space rockets.[/p] [p]Your mind stalls working feverishly. Did your section detach from Patty and Brad's section?[/p] [p]Suddenly the silence is shattered. Your seat lock grinds open, and you are released from your harness. You quickly spin around. Patty's and Brad's cars have disappeared! If this is all part of the ride, maybe you should hop out. But if the ride is broken, maybe you should wait for help.[/p]
p.next: Wait for help to come?
Hop out of the car?

p.text: [p]You sit down on the slide and push off. The world tilts as you plunge down. Down, down, down.[/p] [p]You're scared. But you can't help feeling that this is kind of cool! Sliding and swirling in the darkness.[/p] [p]Until you hear the screams. The eerie screams that follow you as you twist and turn.[/p] [p]Your heart starts pounding wildly. Oh, no! You must have picked the Doom Slide. You're going to slide forever![/p] [p]And, then, [em]bump[/em].[/p] [p]A chute opens up. You hit the ground hard. You tumble over and over and finally stop.[/p] [p]You lie on the ground. Panting.[/p] [p]You're outside![/p] [p]You scramble to your feet and gaze around.[/p] [p]You hear laughter. It seems to be coming from the bright pink building a few feet in front of you.[/p] [p]You walk over to its big pink door and press your ear against it.[/p] [p]Yes. The laughter is definitely coming from inside.[/p]

[p]… they're swinging axes.[/p] [p]Your heart leaps into your throat. The elves move to the roadside now – and they're chopping down the horse-drawn carts ahead of you! One cart splinters into a million pieces before your horrified eyes.[/p] [p]The elves continue on to the next cart. Their sharp blades slice right through it![/p] [p]Your horse keeps trotting up the steep path. You're headed right for the wildly chopping elves![/p] [p]“Do something!” Patty cries.[/p]

[p]Your hand clamps around the can of Monster Blood in your pocket. Quickly you snap off the lid and the green gunk pours out.[/p] [p]“Look! It's alive!” Brad shouts.[/p] [p]He's right.
