The Monster Blood oozes from the can, quivers, and appears to stretch and pull itself up! Then it starts to roll and bounce, making horrible sucking sounds.[/p] [p]Great! It's rolling into the crowd, sucking up everything in its path![/p] [p]“Run!” Big Al screams as the huge green ball rolls over the people in the crowd – sucking them up with a loud plop.[/p] [p]Then the Monster Blood hits the side of the tent. It changes direction.[/p] [p]It's coming after you![/p]

[p]Well, looks can fool you. He is not a wimp.[/p] [p]And he's mad – at you.[/p] [p]In the next moment, he scoops you up and hurls you at the cell wall. His throw is so forceful, you smash right through the wall and soar out of the carnival grounds.[/p] [p]Congratulations! You escaped the Carnival of Horrors – but not in one piece.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Okay, get me out of here,” you say to the dwarf. “Did you help my friends, too?”[/p] [p]The dwarf does not answer. He sprints off and you have to race to keep up with him. Through a confusing maze of twisting tunnels. You're sure glad you have a guide.[/p] [p]The dw^arf suddenly stops. “That wray,” he says gruffly, pointing straight ahead.[/p] [p]Before you can blink, he vanishes in a puff of smoke! And you're left standing in front of twro doors. One red. One blue. The red one has a sign that reads: [span class="attribute"]danger[/span]. The blue one has a sign that reads: [span class="attribute"]big danger[/span].[/p]
p.next: If you leave by the red door
If you try the blue door

p.text: [p]“Help! Help! Over here!” you scream, waving your arms wildly in the air.[/p] [p]“Hold on!” a deep voice answers through the heavy mist.[/p] [p]The boat turns and speeds toward you. As it nears, the voice calls out again. “Jump! Jump over!”[/p] [p]Jump? Is he crazy? Can you really jump onto a moving boat?[/p] [p]The boat is coming closer now. Closer. Closer. You stand up. You bend your knees. You're about to jump – and the boat speeds right past you.[/p] [p]But wait! It is circling back now in a nice, slow approach. It glides up to you, and gigantic hands pull you onto the boat.[/p] [p]“You saved me!” you cry.[/p] [p]You gaze up and gasp in surprise. The man in the other boat isn't a man – it's a monster with a drooling snout and rows of jagged teeth.[/p] [p]“Save you? Save you?” the monster repeats.[/p] [p]His red eyes light up. “Save you … good idea,” he says. “I won't eat you now. I'll save you for a midnight snack!”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END ([em]Burp![/em])[/p]

[p]You make it! You make it out of the park![/p] [p]You also make it out of the state![/p] [p]In fact, the last time anyone saw you, Patty, and Brad, you were all a tiny blip on NASA's radar screen.[/p] [p]Congratulations! You escaped from the Carnival of Horrors.[/p] [p]Happy landings![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“I'm not going anywhere with you, Big Al. I believe the Snake Lady!”[/p] [p]“So do I,” says Patty.[/p] [p]“Me, too!” Brad echoes.[/p] [p]“That's too bad,” Big Al says. Then he turns to the Snake Lady.[/p] [p]“And as for you, Miss Reptilia – I told you, you've been overacting. If these kids believe you, we won't be able to torture them with our real horrors.”[/p] [p]“Sorry, boss,” she says. “So wrhat do you wfant me to do with them?”[/p] [p]You can hardly believe it! Real horrors?[/p] [p]“What kind of carnival is this?” you shout.[/p] [p]“The Carnival of Horrorssssss,” the Snake Lady answers – and that's the good news.[/p]
p.next: For the bad news...

p.text: [p]“We've got to jump,” you tell Patty and Brad.[/p] [p]“It's our only chance.”[/p] [p]“Okay,” Brad agrees as your cart inches up to the chopping elves.[/p] [p]“Come on,” you cry. “Now!” But Brad is too paralyzed with fear to move. You and Patty grab him and haul him toward the side of the cart.[/p] [p]Your cart has reached the elves! One of them smirks as he lifts his ax.[/p] [p]IPs right above your neck.[/p] [p]You picture your head tumbling down the side of the mountain.[/p] [p]With a loud cry, all three of you jump. You land with a thud on a rocky ledge. It breaks your fall.[/p] [p]But the rock is too weak to hold all of you.[/p] [p]You scream again as the edge tears loose and the world drops from under your feet. You tumble over and over, down the side of the mountain.[/p]

[p]You push open the red door. Another tunnel lies beyond it. You follow its twists and turns, and you realize that you're sloshing through cold muddy water. It grows deeper and chillier as you[/p] [p]go.[/p] [p]With a cold shudder, you decide to head back – until you hear a slurping noise behind you. Whirling around, you watch in horrible fascination as giant earthworms crawl out of the mud. Gross![/p] [p]No way you're heading back there. You clench your teeth and slog onward. Up ahead, you see a dim green light. Great! An exit.[/p] [p]As you reach the end of the tunnel, you hear a low growl behind you. At first you try to pretend it's your imagination. But there's no mistaking the sound of thudding footsteps. Getting closer. And closer. And now it's breathing down your neck![/p]

[p]It's a tree branch! Grabbing at you. Tugging, tugging at your hair. You can't break free. Its gnarly stubs dig in deeper as you struggle.[/p] [p]Suddenly you feel something wrap itself around your arms. Then your legs. Closing in tighter. Tighter.[/p] [p]You gaze down and see them – black knobby tree limbs twisting around you. Strangling you.[/p] [p]You drop hold of the steering wheel and begin to claw at the branches, ripping them away.[/p] [p]And then you peer up – and see a terrifying sight. It's a huge tree. And you're headed straight for it! You grasp the steering wheel to regain control of the boat. The tree is just inches away.[/p] [p]Are you going to CRASH?![/p]

[p]“Unless what?” you scream. “Tell me!”[/p] [p]“You can escape the Carnival of Horrors if you leave before closing time.”[/p] [p]“When is closing time?” you shoot back.[/p] [p]“When the last ride stops. ...” the lady whispers. “At [em]midnight[/em].”[/p] [p]You glance at your watch – 11:40. Twenty minutes – that's not so bad. But how do you get out of here?[/p] [p]As if the lady can read your mind, she says, “There's only one right way.”[/p] [p]Then all around you, the crowd begins to chant.[/p] [p]“[em]Only one right way, only one right way[/em]” They repeat it over and over again.[/p] [p]“What is it?” you scream. “Which way?”[/p] [p]It's useless. They're not going to tell you.[/p] [p]But it's not midnight yet. There's still time to figure it out.[/p] [p]Until the floor begins to tremble. And the walls begin to shake.[/p] [p]Earthquake![/p]

[p]“Sorry, Brad. I think Patty's right,” you tell him as you turn toward the Hall of the Mountain King. “I think I spotted an exit there when we first came in.”[/p] [p]Patty runs ahead. “Look!” she cries out. “There's the path. It leads past the Hall of the Mountain King to the exit.”[/p] [p]“Yeah, but who are those people up there?”[/p] [p]Brad asks. “They're blocking the way.”[/p] [p]You peer up ahead and see them – the people in the old-fashioned clothes. And they're still chanting – “[em]Only one right way, only one right way.[/em]''[/p] [p]“They're not going to let us out!” Brad panics.[/p] [p]“Okay. Okay. I have an idea,” you say calmly. “Let's go into the Mountain King ride – maybe we can jump off at the end and sneak past them.”[/p] [p]Do you have another choice? No.[/p]
p.next: If you want to go on the Mountain King ride
If you want to go on the Mountain King ride

p.text: [p]“We've got to get out of here, it's almost midnight,” you say as you run toward the Halloween Express ride.[/p] [p]“Hey, maybe we should try one of these cars,” Brad says, pointing to the red and orange cars that run on a track.[/p] [p]The three of you crowd into a little car that's really meant for two. You jam your foot on the gas pedal, and you're flying![/p] [p]“All right!” Brad cheers. “We're on our way home! Hey, I wonder why they call this [em]Halloween[/em] Express?” he asks.[/p] [p]You turn the wheel sharply to the left, and then you know why… .[/p]

[p]You squeeze your eyes shut and wait for the crash. Finally, you land. You glance up. You're at the foot of the Log Flume ride.[/p] [p]You, Patty, and Brad have lots of cuts and bruises, but you're okay! Terrific! you think – until you spot the army of elves with their axes. They're rushing down the mountain toward you![/p] [p]The only escape is to enter the flume ride, so you dash inside.[/p] [p]The Log Flume reminds you of a western logging camp, complete with log cabins, trees, trucks, and a sparkling blue lake.[/p] [p]In the distance, you can hear the buzz of chain saws. And down by the lake, giant cranes pick up logs and plop them in the water. Some of the logs are hollowed out in the middle with seats for passengers. As you watch, the current catches one.[/p] [p]It glides to the edge of a waterfall, plunges over, and shoots down.[/p] [p]As you glance around, you spot an exit sign.[/p] [p]Then to your horror, you see a giant crane swinging your way. “Duck!” you scream.[/p] [p]Will you make it to the exit? Is this your lucky day?[/p]

[p]Something tells you that this monster is not a robot. This one is for real. Maybe it's the way he stares into your eyes. Or maybe it's the rows and rows of razor-sharp teeth jutting from his mouth.[/p] [p]You take a step back. He takes a step closer. A drop of his drool drips on your hand. It sizzles and bums.[/p] [p]This [em]is[/em] the end, you figure. You'll never escape the Carnival of Horrors. Never see your family or Patty and Brad again.[/p] [p]The monster lifts his gigantic, clawed hand. He waves it over your head. And you wait for the searing pain as it plunges down to strike you.[/p] [p]But that's not what happens.[/p] [p]The monster slowly lowers his hand and clutches at his own neck, and then – pulls his [em]own[/em] head off! And when you discover what's underneath, you know you're still in big trouble![/p]

[p]Your pulse pounds in your ears as you carefully lift yourself out of the car. The tunnel is dark and musty and really creepy. Anything could be lurking in the shadows.[/p] [p]This must be part of the ride, you reason. And the more you think about it, the more convinced you are. You're scared. But you have to admit, this is pretty cool.[/p] [p]In the distance, you spot several red lights that seem to lead to other dimly lit tunnels. You cautiously head toward one of them. Overhead something dark and slimy drips. Splattering on the top of your head. Stinging your forehead.[/p] [p]As you desperately try to wipe the burning slime away, something grabs you by the knees![/p] [p]Aaaah! You look down. A pair of red-rimmed eyes meet yours. It's a dwarf with scraggly red hair and a toothless smile.[/p] [p]“Want me to lead you out of here, kid?” he asks. You're about to follow the dwarf, but then you stop. Is he pail of the ride? He looks really evil.[/p] [p]What do you do?[/p]
p.next: Follow the dwarf?
Decide not to follow the dwarf?

p.text: [p]Yeoow! Someone splashes cold water in your face. Your eyes open.[/p] [p]“Come on! Wake up! It's almost show time,” a[/p] [p]raspy voice says.[/p] [p]“Show time?” you say, gazing into the eyes of a dwarf. “What show?”[/p] [p]“The Freak Show. You are the Amazing Siamese Triplets.”[/p] [p]You glance around and see Patty on one side of you and Brad on the other. You try to pull away from them, but you can't.[/p] [p]“We're stuck together with some kind of glue,” Patty says.[/p] [p]“It isn't glue,” Brad argues.[/p] [p]“Is too!”[/p] [p]“Is not!”[/p] [p]Well, whatever it is – you are stuck. Stuck between your arguing friends for a long, long time – like forever. And here's something you can't argue about. This really is …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Help some freaks? That's a good one! You laugh.[/p] [p]You think about Madame Zeno, the fire, and the disappearing tent. Totally cool! You wonder who thought up such awesome special effects.[/p] [p]You can't wait to tell Brad and Patty all about it.[/p] [p]You search for your friends in the big wooden booths that line the midway. Instead you find incredible games of chance. Some test your eye-hand coordination. Others require pure luck. But they all offer the most amazing prizes you've ever seen – CD players, video games, fifteen-speed mountain bikes. You can't wait to play![/p] [p]You spot a booth across the midway with a crowd gathered in front. That's odd, you think. Didn't Big Al say we were the only people at the carnival tonight? You wonder if your friends are in the crowd. You move closer.[/p] [p]“Oh. I get it,” you say aloud. “These people must work at the carnival.”[/p] [p]You're about to call out to them. Until you see their eyes. Strange, haunted eyes.[/p]

[p]This [em]is[/em] your lucky day.[/p] [p]You duck as the crane swings over your head.[/p] [p]“Run!” you shout to your friends.[/p] [p]You glance at your watch – 11:55. If you're really lucky, you can still make it out of the carnival by midnight.[/p] [p]You can see the exit up ahead. As you charge through the gate, you feel really hopeful – until you run into Big Al.[/p] [p]He blocks the exit with his huge body. His massive hands are planted on his hips. “No one escapes from the Carnival of Horrors!” he roars.[/p] [p]You've got to find a way out. Now![/p] [p]To your right is the entrance to Halloween Express – you could try that.[/p] [p]Or maybe you should run down a different path. There's got to be more exits around here somewhere.[/p] [p]Choose fast![/p]
p.next: Run down a different path?
Halloween Express?

p.text: [p]There's nothing in your pocket but lint.[/p] [p]“Help! Save me!” you cry.[/p] [p]The vulture swoops down and drops you in the nest.[/p] [p]The baby vultures approach.[/p] [p]Mouths open – ready to peck you to death …[/p] [p]But – good news! They don't eat you. You fall out of the nest instead.[/p] [p]Please, close the book fast, or the next sound you hear will be your body, hitting the ground with an awesome [em]thud[/em].[/p] [p class="centered"]THUD[/p] [p]Not fast enough. Okay, don't go to pieces. Pull yourself together and prepare to visit the Carnival of Horrors again – the next time you're brave enough to open this book![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p][em]ZAP![/em][/p] [p]Big Al throws a switch and the magnet shuts off. You come flying down to earth – right where Brad and Patty are waiting.[/p] [p]“I played your dumb game. Now let us go!” you tell Big Al.[/p] [p]Big Al doesn't answer. But the crowd does. “SUD-DEN DEATH! SUD-DEN DEATH! SUDDEN DEATH!”[/p] [p]The crowd surges toward you. They are not friendly. They back you up against a wall. You're trapped.[/p] [p]Trapped by a mob![/p] [p]You reach into your pocket, hoping to find something that might help you. Something to save you …[/p]

[p]You open the door and enter a room bursting with people wrho seem to be waiting for you. You think that's weird until you study them – and realize something even stranger. They're all dressed up in old-fashioned costumes.[/p] [p]“Welcome to the Carnival of Horrors,” a tall woman with a red parasol says, smiling. “Nice of you to join us.”[/p] [p]The Carnival of Horrors. The words send shivers down your spine.[/p] [p]The woman with the parasol whispers in your ear, “Don't you want to knowr the secret of the Carnival of Horrors?”[/p] [p]You nod “yes.”[/p] [p]“The Carnival of Horrors comes alive in a different place and a different time each night. Tonight we're in your town. Tomorrow' we could be in another country! But every place we stop, we [em]invite[/em] kids like you to join us… .”[/p] [p]“Thanks for the invitation,” you say, “but I gotta go.”[/p] [p]“I'm sorry.” The lady chuckles. “You can never escape from the Carnival of Horrors,” she says solemnly. “Unless . .[/p]
p.next: Unless what?

p.text: [p]You turn left. Somewhere ahead of you, you hear laughter.[/p] [p]“Is somebody there?” you call out.[/p] [p]Silence.[/p] [p]You stare at your reflections in the mirrored hall.[/p] [p]Am I trapped? you wonder. Am I in real danger? Or is this all a big, scary joke? Your heart begins to race.[/p] [p]You inch forward a few more steps – moving toward the laughter. Slowly.[/p] [p]“Over here,” a voice calls again. But now the voice seems to be coming from behind you![/p]
p.next: HELP!

p.text: [p]You take charge of the reins to urge the horse on.[/p] [p]“Giddyap, boy,” you and Patty shout. But your horse won't move any faster.[/p] [p]You shoot a glance up ahead. The elves are chopping … and a shiny blade ... is now … right over … your head![/p] [p]“No,” you scream. “NO! Let me out of here.”[/p] [p]You feel a sharp pain. And you realize you've just had the shortest haircut of your life. Unfortunately, they took a little too much off the top.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]The bad news is the Snake Lady fooled you.[/p] [p]“Throw them into the large cell with Harold and all the other [em]prisoners[/em]” Big Al commands.[/p] [p]You are shoved into a dark cell. You hear a [em]click.[/em] You're locked in. As the Snake Lady leaves with Big Al, you can hear their laughter echo down the hall.[/p] [p]You glance into the other cells and think, the freaks [em]are[/em] prisoners. They [em]do[/em] need our help. Then you peer into the darkness of your cell – to find out who Harold is.[/p] [p]There's no way you could miss him. Harold is a giant. He's huge – twice as big as a football player. His hands are, in fact, the size of two footballs. His arms look like tree trunks.[/p] [p]At first you are afraid of him, but then you think, Hey! He's trapped, too. Maybe we can convince him to help us. And then you get a big idea![/p]

[p]You grab the sides of the slide and lower yourself down. The second you sit, the slide's floor tilts up beneath you and propels you forward.[/p] [p]You shriek![/p] [p]You raise your arms and scream louder. You slide faster and faster. In total darkness. Darkness so black, you can't even see your own feet in front of you.[/p] [p]Your eyes dart frantically from side to side. Faces suddenly appear in the darkness in bright flashes of light. Faces of hideous monsters with deformed heads and oozing flesh.[/p] [p]But you're moving too fast to focus on them.[/p] [p]You slide and slide – until the faces stop flashing and you're covered in the thick, heavy blackness again.[/p] [p]You scream as you round a sharp curve. Your head is spinning. You pick up speed.[/p] [p]When will it end?[/p] [p]Then you hear the screams. Chilling screams that echo through the darkness.[/p] [p]Oh, no! You must have picked the Doom Slide![/p]

[p]The creature slides one step toward you, and with a burning stare says, “I am not a robot. I am not going to shut down. So don't bother with any of your silly, human tricks!”[/p] [p]You stare at him. You study him hard. Is he lying? Is he a robot like the other two? Or could he be a lot more dangerous?[/p] [p]Your knees begin to tremble when you think about never going home – never seeing your family and friends ever again. Tears start to sting your eyes. Angry tears! No carnival – not even a Carnival of Horrors – is going to defeat you![/p] [p]You stare deeply into the evil eyes of the creature hovering before you.[/p] [p]Robot? Real monster? You finally decide![/p]
p.next: If you think the creature is a robot, try to knock his head off
If you think heys a real monster or something worse, stay cool

p.text: [p]“The Final Challenge'' Big Al announces. And the crowd goes wild.[/p] [p]Then he turns to you and says, “Remember – the fun games are over. Now you are playing for your life.”[/p] [p]“You go first,” Big Al says to you. You see Brad and Patty taken off to the side by a huge man in a black hood.[/p] [p]Two red-haired dwarfs in clown costumes scurry up the steps. To your surprise, they fit you with new high-top sneakers – sneakers with metal studs running up the backs. This is going to be some kind of race, you think. But then you change your mind – when they snap a heavy, metal helmet on your head.[/p] [p]The crowd's cheers grow louder. Big Al throws a switch. The curtain behind you parts and – [em]Whammo![/em] The wall behind the curtain turns into a super magnet. You go zinging to the wall like a dart to a bull's-eye.[/p]
[p]“FI-NAL! FI-NAL! FI-NAL!” you hear the crowd yelling as you spin round and round.[/p] [p]You're getting dizzy. Really dizzy. So dizzy that you faint.[/p]

[p]“This way!” You wave to Patty and Brad.[/p] [p]The three of you turn to the left and keep running – straight into a pond![/p] [p]“Why didn't you tell us to stop?” Patty whines.[/p] [p]“Don't complain to me!” you shout back. “We followed [em]you[/em] through the fence!”[/p] [p]You turn around and slog your way back to shore. Patty and Brad make it there first. You are a few feet away – when you see [em]it[/em].[/p] [p]An alligator.[/p] [p]With its mouth gaping open – revealing two rows of razor-sharp teeth.[/p] [p]You freeze.[/p] [p]Patty spots the alligator and yells, “Quick! There's a log! Jump on it!”[/p] [p]You scramble up on the log, but it's no use. You're still an easy target.[/p] [p]The alligator opens its huge mouth even wider. He slithers right up to the log. And you can tell he's ready. Ready to crunch down on you![/p]
p.next: Don't scream yet.

p.text: [p]“Yay! Our hero!” the freaks cheer as they bolt out of their cells.[/p] [p]You follow the giant through a side exit. And in no time, you're leading all your new friends to your house.[/p] [p]You're sure your parents won't mind taking them in. After all, how much can a three-hundred-pound giant, a five-hundred-pound fat lady, and a three-headed man eat? Hmmmm. Better not answer that question.[/p] [p]Just be happy that you've come to …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You're not fast enough to get away from the ghost. You're running now, but the ghost swoops down in front of you. You plow into him – and pass right through him![/p] [p]The carnival people are swarming after you.[/p] [p]They don't want you to leave the carnival.[/p] [p]“Hurry!” you yell to your friends – only three minutes to midnight! You dash off in one direction, then another. The carnival people are approaching from every which way. They carry torches with flames that leap high in the air.[/p] [p]You steal a glance at your watch – 11:58.[/p] [p]“We can't let them catch us!” you scream. “Let's hide!”[/p] [p]But where can you hide? Up ahead you see a gigantic cannon. All three of you could fit easily in there.[/p] [p]You also spot a baby ride – the baby choo-choo train – maybe you could squeeze into that.[/p] [p]Quick! Pick one – and hope for the best.[/p]
p.next: Cannon?
Choo-choo?

p.text: [p]You squeeze into the choo-choo and scrunch down. 11:59.[/p] [p]Lights from the carnival people's torches sweep over you. Their foul smell fills your lungs.[/p] [p]The blood pounds in your temples.[/p] [p]You're sure they're going to find you. But you're trapped now.[/p] [p]There's no way out.[/p] [p]You hear someone shout in the distance. “Closing time!” And then you hear a bell start to chime …[/p] [p]… Midnight![/p] [p]“One, two, three,” Brad counts the chimes.[/p] [p]You want to strangle him![/p] [p]“Four, five ...”[/p] [p]Suddenly the kiddie train starts to move.[/p] [p]“Six … seven … eight ...”[/p] [p]You sit up and what you see is the biggest shock of this whole horrible night… .[/p]

[p]The Monster Blood has grown so big – now you can't see over it or around it.[/p] [p]“Run for your lives!” Patty screams. But reaching the door is impossible.[/p] [p]The mound of green slime is bearing down on you. Fast! You stand frozen to the spot. Terrified.[/p] [p]And then – just in time – you, Patty, and Brad leap to the side. And the Monster Blood slams into the wall with a crushing force – and plows right through it.[/p] [p]You stare at the giant gaping hole in the wall. Quickly, the three of you jump through the opening. You are standing outside the main gate – where you came in![/p] [p]There's a wide path of destruction across the field and the forest beyond. From somewhere, a clock chimes twelve times, sending a chill down your spine. And when you peer back at the carnival, it has disappeared. All that's left is a spooky silver mist.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You and your friends squeeze into the cannon.[/p] [p]“Ouch! You're sitting on my hand,” Brad whines.[/p] [p]But you don't have time to apologize.[/p] [p]“Do you smell something … burning?” you ask.[/p] [p][em]BOOM![/em] There's a tremendous explosion. You fly through space. You are headed for a fence that encloses the carnival, and the field beyond.[/p] [p]Will you make it out of the park?[/p]

[p]SUCKER![/p] [p]You didn't really think you could get out this easily, did you?[/p] [p]Check out the title of this book: [em]Escape from the Carnival of Horrors[/em].[/p] [p]Horrors! You need to face a lot more horrors – and then (maybe) you'll escape.[/p]

[p]The fortune-teller said this number might save your life. But how?[/p] [p]Then you see it. In the corner. A tall silver locker with the number [em]132[/em] painted in red.[/p] [p]“In here,” you say, opening the door to the locker. You push Patty and Brad inside.[/p] [p]As soon as you close the door, the locker begins to rattle and shake. You're nearly blinded by a bright, white light. You hear a loud whooshing sound. And then all is silent. The door pops open – and you're amazed at what you see.[/p]

[p]Those eyes behind the alligator snout – those beady eyes. You should have recognized them before. It's Big Al.[/p] [p]“Hey! You did a great job here,” he says warmly. “You've really got the stuff for the Carnival of Horrors.”[/p] [p]“Uh, thanks,” you mumble. “But I really have to go home now.”[/p] [p]“What's the rush?” he asks, patting you on the shoulder. “Aren't you having fun?”[/p] [p]Fun? you think. Crushed between solid walls.[/p] [p]Then attacked by a bulging-eyed monster. Fun?[/p] [p]No. This isn't fun. This is weird.[/p] [p]“Uh, yeah. It's been really great. But, um, I really do have to get home,” you stammer. “So if you'll just take me to wherever Patty and Brad are – and show us the way out – we'll be going.”[/p] [p]“I'm afraid that isn't possible,” Big Al says.[/p] [p]“Just open the door and you'll understand.”[/p] [p]You have no choice. You have to open the door.[/p]

[p]You've got to figure out what you weigh on Mars. Fast. But how?[/p] [p]You're about to give up when you notice a flashing sign. It reads: [span class="attribute"]the gravity on mars is almost 40 PERCENT OF WHAT IT IS ON EARTH[/span]. Okay, now you can figure it out.[/p] [p]Multiply your real Earth weight by four. Now drop off the last digit. For example, if you weigh 90 pounds, 90 x 4 = 360. Dropping off the last digity you get 36 for your weight on Mars.[/p] [p]If you don't want to do the math, you can leave it to luck. Just guess.[/p]

p.text: [p]You open the door and climb a steep ramp that curves around and around. It's cold and dark inside. Halfway up the ramp, you stop. There's another sign: [em]warning! – you may be the one TO SLIDE TO YOUR DOOM![/em][/p] [p]You continue up the ramp. You finally make it to the top, and find yourself standing on a wide, dimly lit platform. A row of long, curving slides stretches out before you. The slides are numbered from one to ten.[/p] [p]You think hard. The Doom Slide. You know you've heard about it before. But where? Where was it?[/p] [p]And then you remember! It was in a GOOSEBUMPS book you read! [em]One Day at HorrorLand[/em].[/p] [p]Now you know you're in big trouble. Because you remember all about the Doom Slide from the book. You remember that if you pick the wrong slide, you'll spend the rest of your life sliding and sliding – forever![/p] [p]Which number is the Doom Slide? Which one?[/p] [p]If you remember which number slide is the Doom Slide (or if you have the book and can look it up), choose a slide that is not the Doom Slide. If you can't remember, you'll have to leave it to luck. Pick a number between 1-10.[/p]
